problem: Find all solutions to the equation $\displaystyle\sqrt[3]{3 - x} = -\frac{3}{2}$.
solution: We get rid of the cube root sign by cubing both sides.  This gives us $3-x = -\frac{27}{8}$.  Solving this equation gives $x = 3 + \frac{27}{8} = \boxed{\frac{51}{8}}$.
chatgpt_solution: Cubing both sides of the equation $\displaystyle \sqrt[3]{3-x }=-\frac{3}{2}$, we find $\displaystyle 3-x=-\frac{27}{8}$.  Solving this equation for $x$ gives $\displaystyle x = \frac{51}{8}$.  Checking, we see that this is a valid solution.  Thus, the equation $\displaystyle \sqrt[3]{3-x }=-\frac{3}{2}$ has just one solution, $\displaystyle x = \frac{51}{8}$.
